plants.name: Lilium canadense
plants.description: A North American wildflower native to eastern regions, featuring bright orange to yellow trumpet-shaped flowers with dark spots. It thrives in meadows and open woodlands.
plants.funFact: Canada Lily bulbs were traditionally used by Native Americans for food and medicine.

plants.name: Rhododendron ferrugineum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub found in the European Alps, known for its clusters of vivid pink to red bell-shaped flowers. It prefers acidic alpine soils and blooms in mid-summer.
plants.funFact: Alpenrose can survive harsh alpine conditions and is often used as an indicator of the timberline.

plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical shrub with large, showy flowers lasting a single day each. Flowers come in various vivid colors and are widely cultivated in warm climates worldwide.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates, notably in summer
plants.funFact: Hibiscus flowers have edible petals and are used to make herbal teas in many cultures.

plants.name: Echinacea purpurea
plants.description: A hardy perennial native to North America, valued for its daisy-like purple petals and distinctive central cone. Commonly found in prairies and gardens for its medicinal properties.
plants.funFact: Echinacea is widely used in traditional medicine for its immune-boosting effects.
